com.vungle.publisher

Class AdConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vungle.publisher.AdConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig

    public class AdConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
    Configuration object for the ad experience.
    See Also:
    VunglePubBase.getGlobalAdConfig(), VunglePubBase.playAd(AdConfig), VunglePubBase.playAd()

    • Method Detail

      • getDelegateAdConfig

        public com.vungle.publisher.ad.BundleAdConfig getDelegateAdConfig()

      • isBackButtonImmediatelyEnabled

        public boolean isBackButtonImmediatelyEnabled()
        Pressing the Android back button during a video ad by default has the same effect as pressing the on screen close button once it appears. However, if this option is set, it enables the user to exit the video at any time by pressing the back button. The default is false.
        Specified by:
        isBackButtonImmediatelyEnabled in interface com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
        Returns:
        true if the user is immediately allowed to exit a video ad by pressing the Android back button; false if the Android back button only exits the video once the on screen close button appears.

      • setBackButtonImmediatelyEnabled

        public void setBackButtonImmediatelyEnabled(boolean isBackButtonImmediatelyEnabled)

        Sets whether the Android back button will be immediately enabled during the video ad, or it will be inactive until the on screen close button appears (the default).

        Once enabled, the Android back button allows the user to skip the video ad and proceed to the post-roll if one exists; if the ad does not have a post-roll the ad simply ends.

        Specified by:
        setBackButtonImmediatelyEnabled in interface com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
        Parameters:
        isBackButtonImmediatelyEnabled - true if back button should be enabled before ad close button appears; otherwise, false

      • isImmersiveMode

        public boolean isImmersiveMode()
        Indicates whether in KitKat (API level 19) and later devices immersive mode will be enabled. The default is true.
        Specified by:
        isImmersiveMode in interface com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
        Returns:
        true if immersive mode will be enabled for KitKat+ devices; otherwise, returns false.

      • setImmersiveMode

        public void setImmersiveMode(boolean isImmersiveMode)

        Specified by:
        setImmersiveMode in interface com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
        Parameters:
        isImmersiveMode - true if immersive mode will be enabled for KitKat+ devices; otherwise, false.

      • isIncentivized

        public boolean isIncentivized()

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • isSoundEnabled

        public boolean isSoundEnabled()

        Indicates whether the video will start with its sound matching the settings of your enclosing application (the default or muted. The default is true.

        Note that the user can still manually mute or unmute the sound during playback.

        Specified by:
        isSoundEnabled in interface com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
        Returns:
        true if the video should start with its audio settings matching those of your enclosing application; false if it should start muted.

      • setSoundEnabled

        public void setSoundEnabled(boolean isSoundEnabled)

        Sets whether the video should start with its sound matching the settings of your enclosing application (the default or muted.

        Note that the user can still manually mute or unmute the sound during playback.

        Specified by:
        setSoundEnabled in interface com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
        Parameters:
        isSoundEnabled - true if the video should start with its audio settings matching those of your enclosing application; false if it should start muted.

      • isTransitionAnimationEnabled

        public boolean isTransitionAnimationEnabled()

        Indicates whether the video transition animation is enabled or disabled. The default is enabled (a fade-in/fade-out animation).

        Specified by:
        isTransitionAnimationEnabled in interface com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
        Returns:
        true if the video transition animation is enabled; false if it is disabled.

      • setTransitionAnimationEnabled

        public void setTransitionAnimationEnabled(boolean isTransitionAnimationEnabled)

        Sets whether the video transition animation should be enabled or disabled. The default is enabled (a fade-in/fade-out animation).

        Specified by:
        setTransitionAnimationEnabled in interface com.vungle.publisher.ad.ConfigurableAdConfig
        Parameters:
        isTransitionAnimationEnabled - true if the video transition animation should be enabled; false if it should be disabled.
